meanings.definition: A person or thing that consolidates or combines things into a single, unified whole.
meanings.sent1: The team captain acted as the consolidator, bringing together everyone's ideas for the project.
meanings.sent2: The puzzle was the consolidator of all the scattered pieces, forming a complete picture.
meanings.sent3: The consolidator squirrel gathered all the nuts in the forest to create a giant nut pile.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was the consolidator of joy in the room, uniting everyone in happiness.
meanings.sent5: The magic wand served as the consolidator, merging the separate objects into one magical item.

meanings.definition: A company or organization that acquires smaller companies in order to create a larger, more powerful entity.
meanings.sent1: The tech giant acted as a consolidator, buying up smaller startups to expand its reach.
meanings.sent2: The financial consolidator acquired several local banks to form a national banking network.
meanings.sent3: The pizza consolidator company bought all the local pizzerias to create a pizza empire.
meanings.sent4: The music label was a consolidator, merging various record labels under its umbrella.
meanings.sent5: The superhero team was like a consolidator, uniting individual heroes to fight crime together.
